title:
Efficient variational quantum eigensolver methodologies on quantum
  processors
authors: Tushar Pandey, Jason Saroni, Abdullah Kazi and Kartik Sharma
abstract:
We compare the performance of different methodologies for finding the ground
state of the molecule BeH2. We implement adaptive, tetris-adaptive variational
quantum eigensolver (VQE), and entanglement forging to reduce computational
resource requirements. We run VQE experiments on IBM quantum processing units
and use error mitigation, including twirled readout error extinction (TREX) and
zero-noise extrapolation (ZNE) to reduce noise. Our results affirm the
usefulness of VQE on noisy quantum hardware and pave the way for the usage of
VQE related methods for large molecules.
